item.title: ã€Šå°ç‹å­ã€‹è‹±æ–‡ç‰ˆ
item.description: To Leon Werth I ask the indulgence of the children who may read this book for dedicating it to a grown-up. I have a serious reason: he is the best friend I have in the world. I have another reason: this grown-up understands everything, even books about children. I have a third reason: he lives in France where he is hungry and cold. He needs cheering up. If all these reasons are not enough, I will dedicate the book to the child from whom this grown-up grew. All grown-ups were once children– although few of them remember it. And so I correct my dedication: To Leon Werth when he was a little boy Chapter 1 we are introduced to the narrator, a pilot, and his ideas about grown-ups Once when I was six years old I saw a magnificent picture
